communications.communication:
Dear FBI:

This is a request for records under the Freedom of Information Act.

RECORDS REQUESTED

All records related to Henry C. Park. Mr. Park was a leftist academic. He was involved in the founding of RADACADS (short for "RADical ACADemics") at Harvard University and in the Maoist International Movement. He co-edited the opinion page of the Michigan Daily while earning his doctorate at the University of Michigan. He sometimes used the pseudonyms “MC3” or “MIM3”. He was born in October 1962, although I am not sure of the date or place of his birth. He died on 17 May 2011. At the time of his death, he lived in Somerville, Massachusetts. He had previously lived in Hopewell Junction, New York. Proof of Mr. Park's death is attached.

CROSS-REFERENCE SEARCH

Please conduct a cross-reference search of your files on the following people and organizations to see if they contain additional records related to Mr. Gray:

(1) RADACADS (the "RADical ACADemics" group at Harvard)
(2) Maoist International Movement

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Francis “Cadillac Frank” Salemme
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The FBI file on Francis “Cadillac Frank” Salemme, who died in prison in late 2022: https://turnto10.com/news/local/ex-mafia-boss-cadillac-frank-salemme-dies-in-prison-at-89-december-18-2022

Please note that I am a reporter for The Boston Globe.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alexa Gagosz

title: Child care licensing records 2019-present (Department of Health and Human Services)

communications.subject: South Carolina Public Records Law Request: Child care licensing records 2019-present (Department of Health and Human Services)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the South Carolina Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Historical licensing data for all licensed child care providers (active and closed) that were open anytime from 1/1/19-present:
•	Provider name or ID
•	Provider address
•	Latest license issue date and expiration date 
•	First license issue date
•	Any additional provider data that your agency collects

If electronic records from before 1/1/19 are available, I’d be happy to collect them as well.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Gabrielle Pepin

communications.subject: Your S.C. Dept of Health & Human Services public records request #23-133 has been opened.
communications.communication:
S.C. Dept of Health & Human Services ************************************************************************ Your record request #23-133 has been submitted successfully. Your FOIA request has been submitted to the South Carolina Department of Health and Human Services (SCDHHS). SCDHHS is the state agency tasked with administering the South Carolina Medicaid Program and BabyNet. If your request does not involve records or information from Medicaid or BabyNet, please redirect your request to the appropriate entity. If your request is submitted outside of business hours, it will be considered received upon the next business day. Please be advised that SCDHHS will provide an initial response in 10 business days as to whether public records exist that are responsive to your request. The South Carolina State Agency Holiday Calendar is posted at https://www.admin.sc.gov/dshr/holiday. ************************************************************************ Reply to this email or sign in to contact S.C. Dept of Health & Human Services.

Change your email settings | Visit our help center
